intro: Kiggelaria hylophila, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is known for its ornamental value due to its bright yellow flowers. It has hairy leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into achene fruits. Kiggelaria hylophila is often used in horticulture for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its drought tolerance.
